gurmukhi: prmM pivqR Bey dyv d`q ]AwiC`j qyj Aru ibml m`iq ]so vrx dyK lwjMq AMg ]soBMq sIs gMgw qrMg ]41]
transliteration: Paramannd Pavitra Bhae Dev Datt|| Aachhijj Tej Ar(u) Bimal Matt(i)|| So Varan Dekh Laajant An|| Sobhant Sees Gadgad Taran||41||
translation: Dutt was a person of purity, indestructible splendour and pure intellect; even the gold feel shy before him and the waves of the Ganges seemed to surge over his head.41.

gurmukhi: Awjwn bwhu Ailpq rUp ]Awd`g jog suMdr srUp ]ibBUq AMg aUjl subws ]sMinAws jog ik`no pRkws ]42]
transliteration: Aajaan Baah(u) Alipat Roop|| Aadagg Jog Soundar Daroop|| Bibhoot An Oojal Soubaas|| Sanniaas Jog Kinno Prakaas||42||
translation: He had long arms and charming body and was a detached supreme Yogi; when he applied the ashes to his limbs, he fragranced everyone around him and he brought to light Sannyas and Yoga in the world.42.

gurmukhi: Avlok AMg mihmw Apwr ]sMinAws rwj aupjw audwr ]AnBUq gwq AwBw AnMq ]monI mhwn soBw lsMq ]43]
transliteration: Anlok An Mahimaa Apaar|| Sanniaas Raaj Oupjaa Udaar|| Anbhoot Gadt Aabhaa Anant|| Monimahaan Sobhaa Lasant||43||
translation: The praise of his limbs seemed boundless and he manifested himself as a generous king of the Yogis; the brilliance of his body was infinite and from his great personality, he appeared to be a silence-observing ascetic and eminently glorious.43.

gurmukhi: AwBw Apwr mihmw AnMq ]sMinAws rwj ik`no ibAMq ]kwNipAw kp`tu iqh audy hoq ]qq iCn Akpt ik`no audoq ]44]
transliteration: Aabhaa Apaar Mahimaa Anant|| Sanniaas Raaj Kinno Beant|| Kaanpiaa Kapatt(u) Tih Ude Hot|| Tat Chin Akapat Kinno Udot||44||
translation: That king of the Yogis spread his infinite greatness and glory and on his manifestation, the fraudulent tendencies trembled and he made them stingless in an instant.44.

gurmukhi: mihmw AiC`j AnBUq gwq ]Aivlok puqR cik rhI mwq ]dysn ibdys cik rhI srb ]suin srb inrK qij dIn grb ]45]
transliteration: Mahimaa Ahhijj Anbhoot Gadt|| Anilok Poutra Chak(i) Rahimaat|| Desan Bides Chak Rahisarab|| Soun(i) Sarab Nirakh Taj(i) Deen Gadab||45||
translation: Seeing his indestructible greatness and unique body, the mother remained wonder-struck; all the people in counties far and near also marveled to see him and all of them abandoned their pride on listening to his greatness.45.

gurmukhi: srbqR pXwl srbqR AkwS ]cl cwl ic`qu suMdr subws ]kMpwiemwn hrKMq rom ]AwnMd mwn sB deI Bom ]46]
transliteration: Sarbatra Puaal Sarbata Akaadh|| Chal Dhaal Chitt(u) Soundar Soubaas|| Kanpaaemaan Harkhanndrom|| Aanand Maan Sabh Daibhom||46||
translation: The whole nether-world and sky had the feeling about his comeliness which made all the creatures full of joy; because of him, the whole earth became blissful.46.

gurmukhi: Qrhrq DUm AkwS srb ]jh qh irKIn qij dIn grb ]bwjy bjMqR Awnyk gYx ]ds idaus pwie idKI nrYx ]47]
transliteration: Thar-harat Dhoom Akaadh Sarab|| Jah Tah Rikheen Taj(i) Deen Gadab|| Baaje Bajantra Aanek Gadn|| Das Dious Paae Dikhidarain||47||
translation: The sky and the earth all quivered and the sages here and there abandoned their pride; on his manifestation, many instruments (musical) were played in the sky and for ten days, the presence o f night was not felt.47.

gurmukhi: jh qh bjMqR bwjy Anyk ]pRgitAw jwxu bpu Dir ibbyk ]soBw Apwr brnI n jwie ]aupijAw Awn sMnXws rwie ]48]
transliteration: Jah Tah Bajantra Baaje Anek|| Pragteea Jaan(u) Bap(u) Dhar(i) Bibek|| Sobhaa Apaar Barnina Jaae|| Oupjiaa Aan Sannyaas Raae||48||
translation: Many musical instruments were played here and there and it appeared that the discriminating intellect had assumed a body itself; his glory is indescribable and he manifested himself as the king of ‘Sannyas’.48.

gurmukhi: jnmMq lwig auT jog krm ]hiq kIE pwp prcuirE Drm ]rwjwiDrwj bf lwg crn ]sMinAws jog auiT lwg krn ]49]
transliteration: Janmant Laag(i) Outh Jog Karam|| Hat(i) Keeo Paap Parchurio Dharam|| Raajaadhiraaj Bad Laag Charan|| Sanniaas Jog Outh(i) Laag Karan||49||
translation: Even on taking birth, he absorbed himself in actions of Yogs; and he, destroying sins, propagated Dharma; the great Sovereign fell at his feet and getting up, they practiced Sannyas and Yoga.49.

gurmukhi: AiqBuiq AnUp liK d`q rwie ]auT lgy pwie niRp srb Awie Aivlok d`q mihmw mhwn ]ds cwr cwr ib`idAw inDwn ]50]
transliteration: At(i) Bhout(i) Anoop Lakh(i) Datt Raae|| Outh Lage Paae Nrip Sarah Aae|| Avilok Datt Mahimaa Mahaan|| Das Chaar Chaar Biddiaa Nidhaan||50||
translation: Seeing the unique king Dutt, all the king bowed respectfully at his feet; seeing the greatness of Dutt, it appeared that he was the store of eighteen sciences.50.

gurmukhi: soBMq sIs jq kI jtwn ]nK nym ky su bFey mhwn ]ibBRm ibBUq au`jl su soh ]idj crj quil miRg crm Aroh ]51]
transliteration: Sobhant Sees Jat Kijataan|| Nikh Nem Ke Su Badhae Mahaan|| Bibhram Bhibhoot Ujjal Su Soh|| Dij Charaj Tul(i) Mrig Charadaroh||51||
translation: On his head, there were the matted locks of his celibacy and on his hands grew the nails of observances; the white ashes on his body were indicative of his state devoid of illusions; his character like Brahm (Brahman) was his deer skin.51.

gurmukhi: muK isq ibBUq lMgot bMd ]sMnXws crj qij CMd bMd ]Asunk suMin Anu ibkq AMg ]AwiC`j qyj mihmw surMg ]52]
transliteration: Moukh Sit Bibhoot Lanot Band|| Sannyaas Charaj Taj(i) Chhand Band|| Asounak Sounn(i) An(u) Bikat An|| Aachhijj Tej Mahimaa Suran||52||
translation: Having white ashes on his face and wearing loin-cloth, he was the possessor of Sannyas and conduct and relinquisher of deceit; he remained absorbed in abstract meditation and his limbs were extremely charming; his radiance was indestructible.52.

gurmukhi: iek Aws ic`q qij srb Aws ]AnBUq gwq insidn audws ]mun crj lIn qij srb kwm ]Aw rkq nyqR jnu Drm Dwm ]53]
transliteration: Ik Aas Chitt Taj(i) Sarab Aas|| Anbhoot Gadt Nisdin Udaas|| Mounndcharaj Ldn Taj(i) Sarab Kaam|| Aa Rakat Netra Jan(u) Dharam Dhaam||53||
translation: In his mind there was only one desire of Sannyas and Yoga and for this desire he had abandoned all other desires; his body was unique and during day and night, he remained detached from the deceits of the world; leaving the desires of all kinds, he had ad

gurmukhi: Aibkwr ic`q Axfol AMg ]juq iDAwn nyqR mihmw ABMg ]Dir eyk Aws Aaudws ic`q ]sMnXws dyv prmM piv`q ]54]
transliteration: Abikaar Chitt Andol An|| Jout Dhiaan Netra Mahimaa Abhan|| Dhar(i) Ek Aas Audaas Chitt|| Saannyaas Dev Paramannd Pavitt||54||
translation: He had a pure mind, devoid of vices, and he meditated with his non-mercurial eyes; his praise was infinite; having only one desire in his mind of adopting Sannyas from all sides; he was the greatest among the immaculate Sannyasis.54.
